availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alney M. Hewlett (Hopkins Co., KY, farmer)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Lemuel Hewlett and Rebecca Hewlett. Married to Sarah A. Hewlett. Father of William P. Hewlett, Charles H. Hewlett, Julie D. Hewlett, Edwin R. Hewlett, and Emma Hewlett. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860. Employed T. Y. McGary as a farm laborer in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Hopkins County in 1860. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 130A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 819.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 220A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Precinct 7, p. 155A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War) NARA RG 110, Hopkins County, KY, September 1863, p. 9.
"Alney M. Hewlett (1829-1871)," Find A Grave, Memorial #69391623, accessed July 22, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/69391623.
